Ad Text:
Sydney CBD

7+ yrs in Data Engineering, with 3+ years in leadership/senior technical role
Hands-on with Snowflake and AWS-native tools (e.g. Glue, S3, Lambda).
Permanent Role| Hybrid working| Attractive salary package

About the Role

The Data Platform Engineering Manager leads the team responsible for designing, developing, and delivering icare’s enterprise data platform and reusable data products. This role is critical to ensuring scalable, secure, and high-performing data capabilities that power insights decision-making, automation, and future AI use cases.

You will oversee the end-to-end development lifecycle – from backlog planning through to tested and automated deployment – while ensuring quality, reusability, and platform alignment. This role also plays a key leadership function in working across teams to shape solutions that enable strategic outcomes for icare.

Benefits

A corporate wellbeing program with subsidised gym membership, free flu vaccinations and health check programs
Comprehensive learning and development support aligned to icare’s Core Capabilities.
Our People Awards - On-the-spot Recognition, Quarterly Values Awards & Our People Annual Awards
Access to our Employee Assistance Program

Duties

It’s an exciting time at icare where no two days are the same; as a Manager, Data Platform Engineering you will:

Lead the engineering team responsible for building data pipelines, models, and reusable components using Snowflake and AWS-native tools (e.g. Glue, S3, Lambda).
Lead the development of modern data platform including analytical feature store, API wrapped data services and enabling embedment of operational analytics into core platforms
Translate business and analytical requirements into well-designed data products, aligned to domain needs and platform strategy.
Oversee the design and delivery of scalable data models, semantic layers, and data marts to support insights and CX solutions.
Embed strong solution design practices and partner with architects to ensure alignment with enterprise patterns.
Manage and coach a multidisciplinary team including Data Engineers, Solution Designers, DevOps Engineers, and Data Test Engineers.
Ensure development standards, best practices, and governance (e.g. naming, logging, lineage) are consistently applied.
Drive adoption of test-driven development, CI/CD, and automation practices across the team.
Collaborate with Data Ops to ensure smooth deployment, observability, and post-release support.
Partner with Performance Monitoring & Insights and CXM Ops teams to ensure platform capabilities meet real-world reporting and customer intelligence needs.
Continuously improve engineering maturity, velocity, and reusability of data products across service lines.
Contribute to GenAI and Agentic AI readiness by building modern, AI-enabled data foundations.

Team Leadership

Inspire and lead a high-performing engineering team, fostering a culture of accountability, technical excellence, and continuous learning.
Collaborate with cross-functional leads across Data Ops, Insights, and CXM, and Governance to support icare’s data strategy.
Support Agile ways of working and contribute to the design of an evolving, service-aligned operating model.

Skills & Experience

7+ years in Data Engineering, including 3+ years in leadership or senior technical role
Proven experience leading Data Engineering or Data Platform teams in complex, cloud-native environments
Demonstrated success in delivering scalable data pipelines and reusable data products
Experience implementing engineering standards, code reviews, and reusable frameworks
Track record of enabling insights, CX, or AI teams through platform engineering
Strong technical knowledge of modern data platforms (Snowflake, AWS)
Deep understanding of data pipeline design, ELT/ETL patterns, and data modelling principles
Proficiency in CI/CD, testing frameworks, and deployment automation
Ability to lead multidisciplinary technical teams across development lifecycles
Excellent stakeholder communication and collaboration skills
Experience setting standards and best practices for engineering teams
Experience in Agile delivery environments, virtual squads, or service-aligned team models
Exposure to real-time data ingestion and event-driven architecture
Contribution to GenAI or advanced analytics-enabling platforms
Familiarity with data mesh or federated data product design
Knowledge of data governance, metadata, and lineage practices
Understanding of public sector or regulated industry environments

Culture

We know our strength comes from the diversity of our people and would encourage people with different experiences and backgrounds to apply. We are committed to our people’s development so the people of NSW can thrive.

About the Company

Our purpose is to care for the people of New South Wales, building confidence and trust so our communities can thrive. As NSW’s agency of insurance and care, in the past year we insured 338,000 businesses, covering four million workers and supporting 92,000 workers with injuries. We cared for over 1,800 people severely injured on our roads and supported more than 5,450 impacted by a dust disease. We helped 775 homeowners, insuring $20.9 billion in residential projects, and continue to protect $436 billion in NSW Government assets including iconic landmarks the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. icare continues to refine and transform how we deliver services to improve experiences for those we serve.

For more information about icare visit our website
icare operates a direct sourcing model so no agency introductions will be accepted
We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant
A talent pool may be created through this recruitment process.

If you are an employee of icare please apply via Hugo to submit your application. We want to support you with the next step in your career.

Please note that you must be an Australian citizen, permanent resident of Australia, New Zealand citizen with a current New Zealand passport or have unrestricted working rights to apply for this role.

Job Title: Senior FP&A Manager - Technology, Risk & Transformation
Ad Text:
Job Description


Hi. We're OFX, a leading financial operations company providing businesses and accounting firms with real-time financial control and visibility to do business anywhere in the world. With an innovative platform and 24/7 human support, OFX automates and simplifies doing business across borders, reducing risk and eliminating routine operational tasks. Offering global business accounts, payments to 180 countries in 30+ currencies and currency risk management solutions to simplify global payments. OFX further enhances business operations by providing corporate cards with spend management, bill payments, vendor management, and integrations with popular accounting and HRIS software, to help achieve better business solutions so accounting firms and businesses thrive.

Headquartered in Sydney, Australia, with offices globally, in the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Ireland, New Zealand, Singapore and Hong Kong. OFX has been a trusted innovator in global money movement for over 25 years.

Purpose of your role

We are looking for a Senior FP&A Manager to lead financial planning and analysis for our Technology, Risk and Transformation functions. This is a high-impact role for a finance leader who thrives on influencing strategic decisions, driving performance, and shaping investments that enable growth and innovation.

You will partner closely with executive leaders, providing actionable insights, robust financial governance, and a clear line of sight into the return on investment for technology and transformation initiatives. This role is ideal for someone with a strong commercial mindset, deep FP&A experience, and a demonstrated track record of supporting software and platform development through capitalization and performance measurement.

What You Do

Executive Business Partnering: Act as the primary finance partner for Technology and Risk and Transformation leaders, providing proactive insights that influence strategic decisions and value accretive business outcomes.
Financial Planning & Analysis Leadership: Own the budgeting, forecasting, and long-term planning processes for your portfolio, ensuring alignment with corporate strategy and enabling data-driven decision-making.
Performance & Investment Oversight: Lead month-end reporting, highlighting performance versus plan, key drivers, and actionable insights. Provide oversight of software and platform development investments, including CAPEX/OPEX tracking, capitalization, and ROI analysis.
Capitalisation & ROI Expertise: Prepare and maintain robust business cases for technology and transformation initiatives. Measure and report on financial and operational returns from software/platform investments to guide future spend.
Risk & Governance Alignment: Partner with Risk and Compliance teams to ensure investments are appropriately governed and aligned with organizational risk appetite.
Process Improvement & Automation: Lead initiatives to enhance FP&A processes, improve reporting efficiency, and implement tools for better investment measurement and insight delivery.
Team Leadership & Coaching: Mentor and develop junior FP&A professionals, fostering a high-performing, collaborative finance team.

Qualifications


What You Bring

Qualifications: Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related discipline; CA/CPA/CFA (or equivalent) preferred.
Experience: 8–10+ years in FP&A, Commercial Finance, or Decision Support roles, ideally in software, digital platforms, or technology-driven businesses.
Software/Platform Investment Expertise: Proven experience in capitalizing technology/software development, tracking costs, and measuring financial and operational ROI.
Strategic Influence: Ability to partner with senior executives, providing insights and challenging decisions with confidence and commercial clarity.
Technical Skills: Strong in budgeting, forecasting, financial modeling, investment appraisal, and scenario analysis.
Communication: Exceptional ability to convey complex financial information in a clear, actionable manner for both technical and non-financial stakeholders.
Leadership: Experience mentoring or managing finance teams, developing talent, and fostering collaboration.
Mindset: Commercially astute, detail-oriented, and highly organized, with a focus on driving results in a fast-paced, transformative environment

Additional Information


Why Join Us?

Lead finance for transformative initiatives that shape the future of our technology and risk landscape.
Work with senior leaders to directly influence strategic investments and business performance.
Join a collaborative and high-performing finance team with opportunities for growth and impact.

What it's like working at OFX

We’re OFXers because we want to make a difference. We see challenges as opportunities and we’re not afraid to roll up our sleeves to get stuff done. We’re committed to making things easier for our clients, pushing boundaries and continuing to move with the times so that we can continue to inspire confidence every day and through every transaction.

We operate as one team, cross-functionally and globally, to drive outcomes that deliver excellence for our customers. We're curious self-starters who love learning and sharing our knowledge with others. We embrace change and use our initiative and resilience to overcome challenges.

Always keep learning. We offer a wide range of learning and career development opportunities to help every OFXer build their capacity and career, with leadership training, secondments, internal mobility and access to a large library of online learning.
Make a difference. Through our Make a Difference program, we encourage OFXers to give back to causes and communities that are important to them. We celebrate this with an annual volunteer day, which OFXers can use together or individually, as well as matched giving and the opportunity to nominate charity of choice every quarter.
Reward and recognition. We recognise a job well done. OFXers are encouraged to celebrate their peers’ effort, technical expertise or support through a range of global and regional channels and awards, including quarterly and annual awards, milestones and shout outs.
Showing our social side. Our Good Vibes employee-led committees around the globe organize events to help keep our employees engaged inside and outside the office. Whether it’s a wellbeing activity, end of year celebration, or a monthly team get-together, our team wants you to feel welcome!
Benefits that mean something. We offer a range of fantastic benefits, including primary and secondary gender neutral carer parental leave (16 weeks) or birthday leave, you'll feel well-supported at OFX.
A great work environment. Enjoy work-life balance and flexibility with our hybrid work model, in an inclusive, diverse and non-hierarchal culture.

#Li-Hybrid

At OFX, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace where we value, respect, and encourage our people to be their authentic selves. With an employee base as diverse as the clients we serve, we know that fostering an inclusive workplace is fundamental to our continued success. If you require accommodation for any portion of the recruitment and hiring process, please email us at people.culture@ofx.com.

We encourage you to apply if this role aligns with your career aspirations.

We're looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Business Analyst to support workflow analysis, requirements discovery, and process documentation across a range of CRM-related initiatives. While any CRM experience is welcome, this role is primarily focused on business analysis, not systems administration.
 
Job: Business Analyst
Location: Canberra
Engagement: Part-time (2-3 days per week)
Level: Mid-level (2+ years experience)
 
Key Responsibilities

Conduct business discovery activities, including stakeholder interviews and workshops.
Analyse and document current and future-state workflows, processes, and business rules.
Gather, validate, and clearly document business, functional, and non-functional requirements.
Produce high-quality documentation including process maps, user stories, requirements specifications, and gap analyses.
Collaborate with technical teams, SMEs, and business stakeholders to ensure shared understanding of requirements.
Support solution design by translating business needs into clear, actionable documentation.
Contribute to continuous improvement of processes and documentation standards.
Skills & Experience

2+ years' experience as a Business Analyst (mid-level).
Experience with CRM environments (any platform), or strong ability to quickly learn new systems.
Background in workflow/process analysis and requirements discovery.
Strong attention to detail and excellent documentation abilities.
Ability to communicate clearly and confidently with stakeholders at multiple levels.
Experience in a systems analyst capacity is beneficial, but the role is primarily business-focused.
CPA qualification or accounting/finance domain knowledge is a bonus.

Job Title: Policy Analyst - Federal Government | Baseline Clearance Required
Ad Text:
$80–$100 per hour (including super) 
Contract opportunities 
Canberra-based or Remote with Onsite as Required 
Are you an experienced policy professional with a strong understanding of the Australian Public Service (APS) environment? We are seeking high-calibre Policy Analysts with demonstrated government experience to support multiple projects working alongside the Commonwealth. 

In this role, you will contribute to meaningful public policy work, partnering with government stakeholders and engaging across complex subject matter areas. You’ll draw on your APS knowledge to shape policy direction, inform decision-making, and support high-impact outcomes. 

About the Work 
You will be involved in a variety of policy and analysis activities, which may include some or all of the below: 

Developing new policy proposals, options papers and regulatory material 
Drafting and reviewing legislative or regulatory amendments 
Conducting impact analysis, feasibility studies and first-principles reviews 
Preparing business cases and supporting documentation 
Engaging with diverse stakeholders to test assumptions and refine policy settings 
Contributing to Cabinet submissions, budget processes, Ministerial briefs and correspondence 
Providing high-quality analytical advice to senior executives and decision-makers 
This work will suit candidates who thrive in dynamic environments, can quickly integrate into government contexts, and enjoy applying structured analysis to complex policy problems. 

About You 
To be successful, you will have: 

Previous experience working within the APS or Commonwealth Government 
Demonstrated experience in policy development, legislative processes, or regulatory reform 
Experience preparing high-quality written products for senior audiences 
Exposure to budget processes, Cabinet submissions, Ministerial correspondence, or similar 
Ability to work autonomously, deliver high-quality outputs at pace, and use technology as a means to improve productivity 
A minimum Baseline security clearance. 
We are particularly interested in candidates who can bring a mature policy skill set, sound judgement, and the ability to step into complex work with minimal guidance. 

What’s on Offer 

Competitive rate of $80–$100 per hour including super 
The opportunity to support a variety of meaningful Federal Government projects 
Flexible working arrangements, including hybrid and remote work 
The chance to work with a professional, values-driven consulting team 
If you are an experienced policy practitioner looking for your next opportunity and enjoy contributing to high-impact government work, we’d love to hear from you. 

Apply now with your CV, and we’ll be in touch as suitable opportunities arise. 

1 and One Consulting partners with government to deliver meaningful, high-impact projects. We work across multiple portfolios, and successful candidates will likely have the opportunity to transition onto other projects after this engagement.

Company Description

Do amazing work 

A career with Viva Energy is more than just a job. It’s a chance to join a group of people dedicated to supporting Australia’s evolving energy and convenience needs. We’re a leading retail, industrial and energy business, and we’ve been helping Australians reach their destination for more than 120 years.  

Our plans for the future support Australia’s energy transition to sustainable, lower carbon energy solutions. And our recent acquisitions of Coles Express and OTR, we provide Australians with outstanding convenience. 

At the heart of our plans is people power. People who want to grow and evolve with us. People with new perspectives, energy and passion to drive Viva Energy and their careers forward.  

About Viva Energy 

Join a team that values diversity. Viva Energy is a great place to be yourself. We believe in our people, trust in their positive intentions, and empower everyone to amplify their voice across the business. We value inclusion because that’s how we get the best outcomes. 

Awarded the WGEA Employer of Choice for Gender Equality for the past five years highlights that we are driven by our people and continuing our focus on making Viva Energy reflect the ever-changing face of Australia.  

Job Description

Join Our Team as a Senior Finance Analyst at Viva Energy Australia. We’re looking for a strategic and commercially minded Senior Finance Analyst to partner with our T&D and Business Development/New Energies teams. In this role, you’ll lead budgeting and forecasting, deliver insightful variance analysis to the ELT, and develop robust financial models that shape investment decisions and new energy projects.

If you thrive on influencing outcomes, driving cost optimisation, and providing actionable insights that support growth and innovation, this is your opportunity to make a real impact.

Responsibilities

Partner with T&D and Business Development/New Energies teams to provide financial insights that support strategic initiatives and investment decisions.
Lead annual budgeting and monthly forecasting, incorporating scenario planning to assess commercial risks and opportunities.
Deliver actionable variance analysis and performance reporting to ELT, highlighting drivers of profitability and recommending corrective actions.
Manage operating and capital expenditure, ensuring alignment with strategic priorities and return on investment.
Support cost optimization initiatives and maintain robust financial controls to safeguard compliance and efficiency.
Develop and maintain financial models to evaluate capital investments, new energy projects, and strategic partnerships, enabling informed business case decisions.
Influence commercial outcomes by challenging assumptions, identifying growth levers, and supporting negotiations with external vendors
Qualifications
Ideally CA, CPA or similar business qualification
5+ year finance experience desirable, ideally in an Information Technology/Large Corporate environment
Communication skills, both verbal and written
Fast learner, with a proactive, can-do attitude and a strong willingness to support others.
Analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to use large data sets
Ability to use systems in a large corporate commercial environment, e.g. Excel, Power BI, JDE, Adaptive Insights.
Additional Information

We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and encourage and support diversity in our traditional and non-traditional roles.

Please note: This role is being sourced through Viva Energy Australia, therefore we will not be accepting applications via external recruitment agencies.

Make a difference everyday

Join HammondCare and help improve quality of life for older Australians in need. As a not-for-profit, Christian organisation, we provide expert aged care, home care, dementia care and palliative care. Mission-led, we build passionate teams who support older people through life’s most difficult circumstances.

With over 90 years of experience, we’re known for our relationship-based approach. Whether it’s in our homes, hospitals or the community, we bring skill, empathy and innovation to every moment of care. 

It’s not just care. It’s HammondCare.

About the role  

The Transformation Lead – People & Culture supports the continuous improvement and enhancement of HR processes, working with stakeholders to scope, design and document employee lifecycle activities. The role will have a strong focus on supporting change and transformation initiatives across the People Experience Strategy and broader People & Learning team. A key area of delivery will be working closely with the Workday Functional Leads to drive business process enhancement and improvement, working with the lead and business stakeholders to redesign and document processes, as well as update change artefacts and communicate the changes to the business in a clear and concise way.  This also includes supporting changes associated with system releases.

This role will report to the General Manager of People Operations and Transformation.

Key Focus Areas:

Drive continuous improvement and enhancement of HR process across the People Experience strategy and broader People & Learning team

Work with a range of stakeholders and leads to define, design and document key employee lifecycle initiatives

Strong connection to front line workforce to capture feedback ensuring processes reflect our goal of creating more time to care

Lead people experience initiatives across the People Operations function and broader People & Learning team

To ensure that HammondCare gets the best value from its investment in HR technology

Facilitation of business requirements workshops and meetings to capture and troubleshoot process design

Development of process maps and supporting change artefacts (QRGs) to clearly articulate HR process and ways of working

This role is a permanent full-time position based at St Leonards in Sydney or Malvern in Melbourne, with hybrid opportunities.

What we can offer you

We care about your wellbeing at HammondCare and as a result offer a wide range of health and lifestyle benefits including: 

NFP salary packaging ($15,900 tax free) plus meals and entertainment benefit (up to $2,650 tax free)

Additional leave purchase options and 14 weeks paid parental leave

Flexible working options, including hybrid arrangements

Discounts on everyday products and services

Discounted healthcare memberships - access to network of fitness centres and pools for employees and families

Free access to independent counselling support for employees and families

Health & Wellbeing programmes

Reward & Recognition programmes

Referral bonuses

Career and professional development opportunities

Key Responsibilities include

Analyse information to enable practical, data-driven business decisions, and implement changes based on those decisions

Use insights drawn from both feedback and data analysis to identify problems and find solutions

Prepare strategic recommendations for process adjustments, procedures, and performance improvements

Develop a good understanding of HammondCare’s objectives and procedures to effectively analyse performance, identify inefficiencies and propose and implement solutions

Gather, validate and document business requirements

Model business processes and identify opportunities for process improvements

About You 

Commitment to engage and align with HammondCare’s Christian Mission, Motivation and Mission in Action

A least 5 years demonstrated experience in a Business Analyst role or HR project role where you have been in involved in large scale transformation programmes in complex business environments

Demonstrated experience and understanding in change management

Demonstrated experience in agile methodologies and human centred design

Ability to contribute to decisions around requirement prioritisation, defining scope and viability of solutions

Demonstrated experience in stakeholder engagement

Strong ability to gather and distill information by asking the right questions to define clear requirements

Strong documentation and writing skills - creating documents such as use cases and business requirement documents

Strong planning and organising skills with the ability to prioritise tasks to meet deadlines

Confident presenter - the ability to present findings and recommendations to senior leaders and to manage stakeholder meetings

Strong critical thinking and problem-solving ability

Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail

Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Desirable:

Experience implementing or being an end user of Workday HCM

Experience working within the Aged Care and Healthcare sector




NB:   HammondCare position title for this role is Transformation Specialist - People




To Apply 

If you are ready to make a difference with HammondCare, Apply Now!

Applications close 7 December 2025.

Any questions please email recruitment@hammond.com.au

Pre- Employment Checks  

All short-listed applicants for these positions will be asked to consent to a criminal record check and references.

HammondCare is committed to creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity and inclusion. We strive on creating an equal employment environment where everyone from any background can be themselves.

Join a team delivering meaningful digital transformation.
Our Technology Implementation practice helps organisations unlock the full value of Oracle Cloud ERP through expert analysis, smart solution design, and seamless delivery. We bring deep industry knowledge together with hands-on functional expertise to help clients modernise, streamline, and grow.
The Opportunity As part of the Oracle Cloud ERP team, you will play a key role in delivering end-to-end Oracle transformation projects across a diverse portfolio of clients. You’ll work across the full lifecycle—from project initiation through to go-live and post-implementation support—helping clients adopt best-practice processes and realise the benefits of Oracle Cloud.
In this role, you will:

Work directly with clients to understand their business needs, analyse requirements, and design effective Oracle Cloud ERP solutions.
Lead collaborative workshops to demonstrate capability, gather requirements, and guide clients on best practice and cloud adoption.
Prepare clear, detailed configuration documents and functional specifications.
Continuously grow your Oracle Cloud expertise through training, self-learning, and knowledge-sharing.
Contribute to presales activities, including proposal development and solution support.
Configure Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP applications—including approvals, workflows, security roles, BI/OTBI reporting, value sets, design studio components, and personalisations.
About You You are a strong communicator who can turn complex concepts into clear solutions. You’re proactive, delivery-focused, and thrive in collaborative project environments. You enjoy working with clients, building relationships, and helping teams achieve impactful outcomes.
What You Bring To succeed in this role, you will bring experience such as:

Recent, hands-on implementation experience with Oracle ERP Cloud or Oracle ERP as a functional lead.
Strong configuration and/or support experience in at least four of the following Oracle Fusion ERP modules:
GL, AP, AR, Asset Management, Payments & Collections, Cash Management, Expenses, PPM, Procurement.
A solid understanding of finance processes and the ability to translate them into functional system requirements.
Technical capability in workflow and approvals configuration, security roles, BI & OTBI reporting, value sets, design studio and personalisation.
A consulting mindset—strong documentation, stakeholder engagement, and problem-solving skills.
Why Join Us? As a global professional services firm, we work across industries solving complex problems and guiding meaningful change. Our people differentiate us—skilled, diverse professionals who support each other to deliver high-impact outcomes.
We offer flexible working options, generous leave policies, wellbeing initiatives, learning pathways, salary packaging, and a culture that rewards curiosity and collaboration.
Every career journey is unique. Here, you’ll have the support and opportunity to shape yours.
